page.title: 17Council Estates - Paignton
page.content: Torbay Borough Council opened in 1980 the first seventy council houses that were to become the Great Parks Estate. This new Council estate has medium density housing based upon the central court system surrounded by clusters of houses. The houses are two storeyed and brick built. Each of the court areas have a small play area, though the residents feel it is far too small and also complain that there are no shops on the estate or a community centre, and this on an estate that is many miles from the centre of Paignton. Many of the children who were involved in this Domesday project in fact live on the Great Parks estate.
